bullets.text: U.S. lifts tariffs on coffee, bananas, beef to ease food prices; inflation relief bid.
Economic data backlog persists; Fed G.17 Nov. 18 release delayed; first post-shutdown jobs report due Thursday.
Fears a tanker was seized by Iran in Strait of Hormuz, risking shipping disruptions and oil volatility.
Gold holds above $4,000; safe-haven demand and central-bank buying seen as drivers toward $5,000.
Bitcoin fell below $95,000 amid tech sell-off before bouncing, highlighting crypto’s correlation with risk assets.
Berkshire Hathaway reveals new stake in Alphabet, signaling confidence in Google’s AI-driven cash flows.
German court orders Google to pay €572M for price-comparison antitrust breach, reinforcing EU competition enforcement.
Data center clustering is straining regional grids; electricity prices rising in key states hosting AI infrastructure.
CNBC survey: AI to impact 89% of jobs next year, accelerating workplace restructuring and skills demand.
D.R. Horton adopts AI zoning tool to accelerate housing approvals and expand supply.
Scientists demonstrate propulsion breakthrough toward hypersonic aircraft potentially capable of Mach 10 flight.
Hidden ocean waves rapidly melt Greenland glaciers; satellite images show record-fast Antarctic glacier retreat.
New cholesterol-lowering pill, enlicitide, shows promising clinical results, offering alternative to statins.
WhatsApp to enable third-party chat integration in Europe, complying with EU interoperability rules.
